review: When the founder Jerry and family  opened his first Red Robin in Seattle's Eastlake neighborhood, it was literally of a "conversion"of a tavern that served burgers to the national thematic  chain of restaurants.  The design of this location mimics the first.  Lots of interesting poster art adorns the walls.  Young wait staff.   60's &70's rock and soul music blaring in the background.  The success of Kingen's first RR was due in part to being served strong drinks and original recipe burgers by young waitresses.   Service at this RR is decent as the staff is friendly and knowledgable.  Drinks are decent.  Shakes are filling.  Fries are hot and the burgers, well, they taste the originals.

Love Red Robin.  :)  Sometimes the service is good.  Usually it's great!  This is a favorite place for my friend and I.  When I told the waitress that I wanted to skip the bun on my burger she suggested that I go for the lettuce wrap instead, which was MESSY to eat but not a problem with a knife and fork.  Great idea! The buzzard wings are out of this world. Maybe I'm not a real foodie because I'm gushing over Red Robin, but once I'm out of the waiting area and away from the roving gangs of 8-year-olds, I'm a very happy camper there.
Who can say no to bottomless fries? I mean, c'mon really? Red Robin's food is great for the price and the atmosphere is just outright fun!

wow  there is shitty service and then there is shitty service.  now it is friday at 5pm, but we still are paying, let me get more than 1/3 of the way through my burger before you drop the check, brittney. le sigh, semi decent food and my experience was ruined, thanks, hope your attitude goes noticed.

I don't eat here very often, maybe 3-4 times a year, but in the years I've been coming here I have never experienced the horrors the 1-star reviews describe below. Service has always (for me) was nothing but stellar. Food is a step above your normal corporate chain quality. Don't hesitate to come here.

This is a really good Red Robin.  Some of them stink (the one up in Enfield as a matter o fact).  Some of them are really good.  This one is one of the good ones.  Wait staff are excellent, always getting back to us, following up, then always being pleasant, accommodating and fast.  They don't malinger.  They do their job.  THANK YOU WAIT STAFF.  First off, we did not come here for years because of a raw burger snafu.  We couldn't get a burger cooked.  It kept coming out raw.  We'd send it back and they'd send another raw burger.  I don't know what that was about but it was kind of nightmarish...you'd bite in and it was okay and then bite again and the cow would moo.  Then we went home and waited for the salmonella we were sure we had eaten to set in. But we picked up a couple of groupons, and they are rated by someone as THE BEST BURGER or something so we figured we'd give them another shot.  And lo and behold, they have become amazingly uberGOOD. Frankly I wish we had picked up more, but these couple will do.  Because their service and burgers and other fried fare are superb.   Last night I had a fish and chips with a few shrimp thrown in that was unreal good. I'm not saying the shrimp or the fish were of exceptional quality.  They were typical, but they were fried to perfection!   PLUS before that we had other fried items as our appetizers: onions rings and cheese sticks.  LOTS of them.  They give you lots.  And you eat it all because it's delicious.  And the sauces you dip this stuff into are even more delicious.   The classic burger, whatever they call it is out of this world.  I like the one with the sweated onions, but I don't like bread so I have them put it on lettuce.  Between all the perfectly cooked, delicious meat and cheese and really fresh lettuce and firm sliced tomatoes and sauces, not to mention fantabulous endless fries, I have died and gone to heaven.  Or will just that much sooner because no doubt this isn't exactly good for you, unless you're badly in need of a fat injection.   But no one going to a burger joint really cares about those things.  At least I don't. BTW, I gave it five stars because THIS is what I want from a burger joint! Juicy burgers made with delicous meat and delectable fried other stuff.  And exactly the right amount of attention from their staff.   I have to chuckle at anyone who might consider ordering a salad as their entre at Red Robin.  You are there to laugh at death!  And death laughs back! In the background, you may hear your heart moan ominously.  It's all very Ingmar Bergmanesque.  Deliciously so.
I had an avocado salad,  it was tasty.   Red Robin's a national chain so um... if you haven't been to one I don't know what to tell you!

Went here with my wife and daughters to celebrate a birthday (not mine). The place was busy as usual, with balloons being filled, and kids lining up to lose their parents' money in the Claw machines...but I digress. We were sat in a reasonable amount of time. Our server came by with full hands in a few seconds, letting us know he would be right with us. Sometimes it's the little things that tilt a restaurant experience, and Mike certainly had it down. He came by and took our order, which included their Towering Onion Rings, three burgers of various sorts and a grilled chicken sandwich. The onion rings are always hot, fresh and crispy, with ranch and Baja (spicier) ranch dressings to dip. My wife ordered a mushroom Swiss burger - with sauteed onions, and no bun, and a salad instead of fries. I ordered their "Burnin' Love" burger, which had cayenne seasoning, pepperjack cheese, L&T, all on a corn-jalapeno bun. Amazingly good. Everything we ordered came out exactly as requested...a great time-saver for the wait-staff and cook crew, I'm sure! The fries were perfectly cooked, not greasy, and went very well with their exclusive Red Robin seasoning blend that is perched (pardon the pun) on every table. Drinks included diet sodas, for wich there were refills waiting just as we finished the last few sips. Also the signature Freckled Lemonade, with bits o' strawberry. All paled in comparison and creativity to the Guinness Shake! This was a chocolate milk shake that had the famous stout, as well as a small shot of Jameisons Irish Whisky. The combo was actually not bad, although it was so wonderfully thick it would be all but impossible to drink enough of them to catch a buzz! The crew brought out a birthday sundae for my wife, who is now &^*&* years old...haha I'll never tell! All in all the experience was a lot moer memorable that what anyone should expect from a national chain restaurant. RRs does it well, consistently.

This place is decent, we used to come here, they are quick, most of the servers are pretty good but there are some PWT ppl that work here too that stare a lot.  Anyways, when I used to eat burgers I would always get the avacado one, I think it was the Cali burger or something I enjoyed it.   Also very easy to add an egg which is nice because I do enjoy that on my burgers.  Now that I don't eat meat any more this isn't my first place to go but being someone who is willing to make sacrifices for the people close to me I decided to go here as it was requested as a place to go.  There is really only one maybe two salad options and two maybe three soups still decent but not like the burgers.  The smaller spoon that they gave me wasn't sufficient to eat the soup and i asked for an actual soup spoon but was brushed off.  STILL if I ate burgers I would try this place out once every three months or so.

I don't understand how people rate this place 5 stars. I have visited two times and the 2nd was worse than the first. Burgers are greasy and soggy to the point to where it's just plan gross. Maybe I have had a string of bad luck but I will not be going to this red robin again.

Solid burger joint when you want a mostly fun atmosphere at a price that is easy on the wallet. My son loves this joint. There are some chicken sandwiches there that he likes...and he'll occasionally grab a burger if he's in the mood.  I find the burgers not nearly as tasty as other burger places. And while it's a fun place, there always seems to be a small child wailing her or his head off for some unknown reason.  Table was easily had on a Saturday evening at approx. 5:15...why do I find this unusual when this establishment is next door to the mall? WIFI advertised on the door, too. Unfortunately, it's currently broken. I'm sure it'll be fixed in time.  While I prefer Five Guys or Jakes, Red Robin fits us when necessary.

I had been here in the past for lunch, and always had a fairly decent experience. My most recent visit was less than on par, and sealed my decision to just not re-visit. In the past, the food has always been greasy and very "fast foodish" at best. During this visit, I got the feeling that the wiatstaff really didn't care for their job, and it showed by how unattentive they were.  My girlfriend and I stopped here as it was a good meeting point between myself and someone I was selling car parts to. We decided to grab a beer and some onion rings out on the patio while we were there. I'm glad we only wanted one beer each, since nobody ever came back to check up on us after bring them over. I noticed that the other patio tables were waited on fairly often, yet ours didn't get that same attention. Once we were done eating and were ready to pay, we had to wait a while before the check was even delivered. I noticed that our server was also working behind the bar. Normally this wouldn't have been an issue at all. Unfortunately, the patrons at the bar were attended to instantly and we were left outside to just wait until she was ready to come out to us. Overall this was a very poor visit, and we won't be returning.

I used to go here alot since i work near by and i normally had a good experiance last few times were really bad. The food was greasier than normal and the would bring me more of the "endless fries". Then they messed up my to go order twice, finally i gave up and will never go to this red robin again.

My kids enjoy this place The food is average  & the service is usually good I have to say, there is nothing gourmet about the burgers!! So it's more is a marketing gimmick than anything else Chilli's had probably a Better burger, the menu is more diverse....the sacrifices we make for out kids

I go often and always have a nice experience  the staff are nice and the bonsai burger is terrific. I get that most times.  My wife enjoys the whiskey river burger and chicken sandwich.     Never a bad experience.

Food was good, they have new sauces for the fries now. Recommend sampling them. The campfire sauce tastes like big mac sauce. Waitress was nice, but she charged our gift card first instead of the coupon first.. which was kind of weird. Got it fixed though, so it's all good. If you're in the mood for burgers and have no other options.. guess you could go here. It's just a typical chain red robin, nothing that blew me away.

Decent sized burgers, moderately priced (~$10/burger+fries). Good restaurant atmosphere, given you are seated around the perimeter of the restaurant (booth seats), the tables in the center are under spotlights you will feel like you are on-stage or near the sun. The extra $.99 for unlimited sweet potato fries are totally worth it.

Don't know what is going on with RR.  Ordered soup and meal.  The wait staff asked if I wanted the soup as an appetizer, of which I said yes.  Two tables that were seated after me, and ordered appetizers got theirs, but still waiting for mine.  When asked if I was going to get the soup, he ran off, and ended up canceling my soup order without asking me, then when the meal came out, he said it was his fault, and went ahead and took the soup off of the bill, then asked if I still wanted it, of which I refused.  Come on.....an appetizer is supposed to come before the meal.   What really bugged me was that not just he cancelled part of the order, management did not care, or come over to check in with me.  Same thing happens at the West Hartford RR.  Guess I have to order appetizers with drink order.

All time favorite restaurant!! I go here all the time and never have anything to complain about! Always friendly and great service here and the food is amazing . Every time I try a different burger because there burgers are to die for!!! So far my favorite burger is there chili burger !!! Best meal ever and there fries ... Yummy!!! Great variety of drinks I always get either a smoothie or a freckled lemonade!! This is hands down an amazing restaurant!!! It is a great environment for kid they have a full menu for kids and crayons and coloring paper for kids also give away balloons to the kids. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone !!!

Just meh is the way to put it.  We got guacamole & chips for an app the guacamole can in a tini little plastic cup (one you would see a side order of sauce in). Granted it was $5 app but really??? And the guac wasn't that great-but hey, it's not a mexican restaurant either.  Service was pretty terrible. Check was dropped when we were about half way done with our food.  Just for that i'm going to sit here extra longer.  I had to ask for napkins after the app was dropped...FYI-they gave us our app with no napkins or silverware on the table and never came back to see if we wanted anything. Therefore i had to ask the hostest. When i asked the hostest if they had any silverware he said no and walked away.....thankfully there was another hostest that just shook her head at him and went and got me some. Oh sure dude, i'll eat my salad with my hands, thansk for your help. Dummy.... Fries were mush and cold. I got a standard fried chicken burger. Hard to screw up.  However, the margaria i had for a drink was very good.

I always enjoy eating here, great environment! Also it seems the the server always really enjoys his or hers job. Great place to go with family or friends. I suppose it's like any other red robin. But I don't know, it's delicious and I've never had a complaint!

Service here was a 5 (yay Justin!). Only issue was the food. They don't have any nutritional info about their food on the menu. Our server had to give us his cell phone with the app on it. The app is stupid and difficult to navigate just to get the nutrition. Well anyway, food arrived. I ordered the burnin love burger with turkey and no aioli. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great. I ordered a side of broccoli instead of fries and I was given literally 3 pcs of broccoli. Justin even thought that was weird so he offered to pick up another serving. He was super happy to help and very attentive. Great service. My fiancé ordered the California chicken burger it was cooked very well and was very tasty.

I just don't know what there is to get excited about. I don't generally bother to review such massive chains, but this one deserves a mention.  Boring, totally mediocre. Like, right down to the so-called famous burgers; the server asked my wife how she wanted her burger cooked. Medium rare, she replied. But the server said "We'll try but we usually only do medium." Huh? I had heard another server actually tell her guests that they couldn't serve anything less than medium because of liability issues. Seriously? Good to see a chain stand behind the quality of their ingredients. Well, my wife's burger came out brown throughout. Nowhere even close to medium. My guess is, the volume here is so high that they just throw a thousand burgers on the grill at one time and you get whatever is ready when your order comes up. For a restaurant that calls itself a burger joint, that's a pretty sorry-ass excuse for cooking burgers.  I had a French Dip, which was once again totally unremarkable. We paid $50 for lunch. Never again.

Our server was Mike and he was awesome! We went there for lunch and my husband just started a new, strict diet where he can't eat carbs so Mike gave us some great suggestions on alternatives such as a lettuce wrap as well as other sides he could have besides french fries. Mike was attentive and friendly and the food was great. We will definitely be back to see Mike! :)

Came here with a friend.  They were busy but we were seated right away, friendly waiter by the bar area.  Onion ring app is too many onions but maybe you will like that, just thought it was too big for 2 people.  Whiskey burger was good, cooked perfectly.  No complaints

I have been to this location several times and it's a toss up each time. I'm under the impression the kitchen sucks and doesn't read tickets. About half the time I go to eat in or pick up takeout, the order is wrong. One time our waitress recommended that my boyfriend get the spicy BBQ sauce on the side of his (tenders or ribs can't remember), because it's so hot and people have complained. I saw her write it that way on the ticket... But when the food came out sauce was slathered all over them. She tried to go above and beyond and the kitchen messed that up.    Another time I was at a work lunch with about eight people and as our food came out one of my coworkers noticed his salad was wrong. They took the salad back and comped him for it, but by the time they brought him a new one we were all done eating. He ended up getting it to go. Terrible considering it was just a salad. I loooove their veggie burger, and my boyfriend gets the royal burger with the fried egg on top. Last time we ordered take out both the burgers were beef, and the time before that they got the toppings right but on the wrong burger. Needless to say we don't leave the parking lot without inspecting our food.  The food is good when it's made right, I think their issue is more on the staffing end.

With so many burgers to choose from, you're bound to find a few that suits your taste. I find myself experimenting and trying different burgers. Fries are of the steak variety and are "bottomless". Full bar to get any drink you want. We always have great service regardless of how crowded it is. As far as chains go, this one is close to the top of my list.

This used to be one of our favorite restaurants in the area for a good burger. They used to have consistent service and I feel that the quality and service has declined considerably. We asked for a booth and they sat us in one of those 2 seater booths that could barely give you arm room to move comfortably, so that was disappointing. Perhaps we should have been more specific and asked for a booth that comfortably seats two adults? We were there this past week, and selection wise, for the burgers, I do think that they have a good selection. The fries used to be a favorite of ours and this time they (2 baskets) were both soggy.. I asked the waitress to please bring another basket and this basket (delivered 15 minutes later ) was a soggy AND stale tasting mess.  I ordered a salad and it was 95% lettuce and 5% fixins. I asked for two sides of dressing and they only delivered one.. My friend got a chicken burger and agreed that the fries were not so great. The service was lacking and the food that we used to like has declined. The bad news for Red Robin is that with the restaurants in the area they need to be competitive and provide good service or someone else will.

Food was... Eh decent, we got a ton of extra French fries. The staff was good but we sat at the bar and there were tons of fruit flies everywhere!! Gross! Not the staffs fault. There were even two returned drinks from other customers while we were sitting there for fruit flies in them. And don't feel so good about my food and drinks...

I am not from this area but my mom and I were in New Britain and decided to head up to Manchester to do some shopping and grab lunch. We walked in and were greeted immediately, brought to a table, and our waiter was promptly there taking drink orders. My mom and I both got the guacamole bacon burger which was perfect. Perfectly cooked and had a decent amount of bacon. Not like other places that barely put a slice on and call it a day.  I don't eat potatoes so I never get the bottomless steak fries.  I opted for a side salad which is bottomless as well.  For dressing I wanted oil and vinegar which was no problem.   When that came out though the oil bottle was very oily and quite sticky.  Obviously they don't wash the bottle before they pour more oil into it.  And we received an order of fries.  We didn't touch it and our waiter told us that they're on the house even though we didn't order them with our meal.   Overall pleasant experience besides the oil situation.

The service was quick, seated quick, refills quick. Food so so speed.  Fish and chips with sweet potato fries ok. But fries cold. Supposed to be unlimited sweet potato fries. Not....  The bottomless root beer float great.  Over all not bad but the child fries have bad impression.

I've been to this Red Robin a handful of times and have never actually had a bad meal. It's been a year or two since I've had Red Robin, since the only one close to me back in Columbus shut down. I've always enjoyed their burgers and the unlimited fries (along with the seasoning) so there isn't much to complain about. On this latest trip, I realized they've really added a lot to the menu, or least a lot more burgers. I thought they had a ton of burgers before, but it looked like they added a whole new page. I actually went with the Tavern burger, because you can 'style' it to your choosing, and I went with the 'Fiery Ghost' style, which adds their ghost pepper sauce and fried and fresh jalapenos to the burger. I think I added bacon is well, because that sounds like something I'd do. All-in-all the burger was pretty tasty, but it really wasn't all that hot, considering the way they describe it. The fries were decent, but nothing crazy good, maybe a little cold. The server was just OK, but I wasn't expecting much. The server was friendly and actually recognized our Huntington Bank card from being in the Midwest, so we chatted a bit. I'd definitely come to Red Robin more often if there was one around me, because they do provide a decent meal at a fairly cheap price.
I'm sorry 14.00 for a burger that tastes like dish rags half the time the fries are cold. This is the worst hamburger corp in ct might as well eat dog crap sorry there's nothing good about this place
The both times we have eaten here the food was really good. The service was ok, but nothing to brag about.
Working right around the corner, I  come here often and have NEVER had a bad.experience or meal.  The burgers are excellent and the unlimited fries are a nice bonus.  Staff is very friendly.

Well our first visit is our is our last visit. Silverware was placed at the end of the table and to boot, forks and knives were dirty. Ordered a dirty martini...they had no olives and no olive juice!!! Bleu Ribbon burger was nothing spectacular. And got called Hon by the waitress twice, right in front of my wife no less. Service was not impressive, food not impressive and same with the drinks. Red Robin, not so yum.

Ate here for lunch yesterday afternoon.  It was my first visit to any Red Robin restaurant.  I was highly impressed.  Great fries, great burgers, the whiskey bbq wings were really delicious and I love the open, social atmosphere.  Wait time wasn't too long and our food was delivered very quickly.  Pleased by this experience, I hope all Red Robins are this good.
Almost like a cult following. They are not gourmet burgers, but they are very good and you can make a ton of varieties with their toppings. Also love the appetizers- the onion tower in particular.

Great burgers! And the nachos as an all were great! Perfect for 2-4 people, real cheese and loaded with beef and fresh guacamole, delicious!  Lilo was our server and she was great! Super friendly and extremely attentive. Didn't have to ask twice for anything! Definitely recommend this red robin :)

This place has gone downhill, unfortunately. It took us almost an hour to get our food. Our order was lost in the kitchen & the kitchen staff kept telling our waitress that the food would be right out whenever she checked up on it. I found a manager to complain to, and he did profusely apologize for what happened and comped our meals.
The French fries are unbeatable, and I had a mint brownie milkshake the other day that was to die for.
Extremely SLOW. .. where's the bottomless fries?  Been waiting for more than an hour for a burger. WTF. This place is horrible.. I wouldn't even give it a star.
Went to Red Robin today. I got the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Sandwich. It was very tasty. The service was great and so was the food. I will definitely be back.

The service was great. My burger was okay. The sweet potatoes fries weren't fresh :( I do like that they offer the endless fries deal but maybe they should make the fries tastier so that people will want to go for the endless fries deal.
Food was good, service not so much.  Waited an hour for our food after appetizers were brought and the well done burgers were still pink. :(

Ideally I would worry about getting bad service writing a yelp review while still in a restaurant however, I don't think that's possible. First let me say that as advertised the onion rings were great. I don't know what the hell my order was in the came out over half an hour in pieces. It's certainly bottomless Broccoli if you're willing to wait a half an hour for two or three stalks. Order the special fun if you want to regular bun if you don't want to leave on good luck. Besides that, and the fact that I've been here for three hours for lunch, every things great.

Terrible service! Tried to call for take out. The first time I was on hold for over 5 minutes and then got disconnected. Second time I waited for about 3 minutes before I hung up and called back and tried to explain what had happened. Was asked to hold again, just gave up and called a different restaurant that understands customer relations and has burgers that are just as good.

cheap. good burgers. balloons for the kids. plenty of people always in here and the atmosphere is lively. volume is an issue at time but that's part of the reason we go here in a pinch with the kids, so they can act like kids (withOUT running around the restaurant) and no one cares.

The burgers are really good.. Especially the Fiery Ghost one.. Gives the kick of the lifetime.. Burning love is good too.. The only drawback r the beverages.. Aren't one of the best.. Service is good though.. Servers are very nice..

I came here with my girlfriend after a day of hopping around the Westfarms area and we decided to stop in by here for some dinner.  It was a Sunday evening and the place seemed packed, but I guess the tables near the bar were free and open.   So, we quickly got a seat and the waitress came over.  We ordered a milkshake to share, which was quite good.  It was thick, but not so much that it would be difficult to drink with the straw.  We also ordered a couple burgers.  She got a special one from the menu that came on a brioche bun.  I got a tavern double.  The one new thing we tried was the honey bacon dipping sauce.  It looked a little odd when it came to the table, since it was cold and it looked like bacon fat had solidified around the bacon, but it was surprisingly delicious.  That, I believe, was the only sauce we thoroughly finished (but probably partly because it actually cost something).   Getting the attention of the waitress again to get the check was a little tough, but she was professional throughout, so no problems with service.  We're a fan of the bottomless fries, so we would probably come back here again.

NOT as good as they used to be. My family went their to celebrate our daughter's birthday on Wednesday. It just so happen that the local Girl Scouts had a table setup immediately as you walked inside. I was immediately asked by them if I was interested in buying their cookies. I said no thank you, and a 2nd time, she asked me again??? I told her, look , we're here to celebrate my daughters birthday and not buy your cookies. How rude! To make matters worse, management allowed the Girl Scouts to put their table within 2' of where customers walk through their doors. Not on the side, which would've been a better alternative. My 7 yo, was crying at the time because her favorite video game was not there, and the last thing I needed was to be approaced immediately by the Girl Scouts. How about let the customer decide if we're interested. ???? Very poorly executed by Red Robin's Management Staff. So, that just set off a bad vibe and things got worse from there.  We sat down, our daughter noticed from the children's menu, for some odd reason , Red Robin stopped selling their famouse cheese quesidilla's. She was very upset about that too. She went with the pizza and thought it tasted disgusting. I tried some and agreed.  The best part was when the staff came over at the end of the meal to sing Happy Birthday and gave her a sundae! Which barely salvaged our dining experience.  On a side note, my burger came out fine, but my wife's salad was brought to our table without the chicken, because the waitress said it wasn't ready yet,so why bring it out? My wife was easting a plain old salad for about 5 min, until they brought out the chicken which was supposed to be the main part of the salad. Just a crazy day, and in the middle of the week with this many mistakes?? Oh, the line cooks , as I'm remembering, were unprofessional, laughing outloud and fooling around. We could even hear this from afar. At least our waitress was pretty good, though she brought out a half salad without the chicken.  This Red Robin location in Manchester, is not consistent with the way it's quality was over the years. I hope that someone from Headquarters reads this and reorganizes the way this location is running.  I just have hope for this location in Manchester near Buckland Hills Mall.
The service works going backwards. Then after waiting 45 minutes they forgot the 2 year old pizza. When we got ours its was ice cold. DO NOT BOTHER with this place!!!!

Went there for a late lunch with a party of 2. When we walked in we were greeted by the hostess who told us it would be a 10 minute wait. While waiting for a table there was no sitting room because so many people were also waiting. I decided to use the opportunity to use the facilities. While walking to the back I counted 13 open tables. After over 10 min of waiting and seeing no one being seated, we left. Even if you arn't staffed correctly, seating them would at least make them feel welcomed.

I don't eat out much, but when I do, I always try to give my business to a locally-owned joint.  But I get it: There are those times when the easiest "consensus restaurant" for a group dinner is a chain restaurant. Given that chain restaurants exist, first and foremost, for profit and not customer service (looks like my economics student bias is coming out), I don't expect much from chain restaurants; though, I don't believe it is unreasonable to expect the correct order, especially since chain restaurant menus are fairly standardized.  I ordered the crispy arctic cod "burger", substituting the standard sesame seed bun with a croissant (the free bun substitution, I admit, is a neat feature of Red Robin restaurants).  Unfortunately, my "burger" came incomplete, without the promised shredded cabbage on top of the cod fillet.  I don't know if this had to do with the fact that the croissant made the sandwich significantly harder to stack, but it was, nonetheless, disappointing to be gypted out of a complete "burger". Fortunately, the staff here was quite kind and accommodating with our large group, especially given the fact that I arrived much later than the rest of my group and the fact that my group unintentionally stayed through the restaurant's closing time.  And anyways, meeting friends for dinner is about the company more than the food.  This Red Robin location provided a welcoming atmosphere for a fun meal, so I really can't complain much.
This is my favorite burger place. Amazing food. I crave it all the time lol. I wouldn't go there on weekends it's packed

so 2nd visit was nt that gr8.  i am disappointed in both service n food this time.  i ordered garlic herb fries, margarita n garden burger with jalapeños corn bun. it took 20 mins to get my food and more over after wait of 20 mins food was nt that gr8. fries were some what regular without garlic n herbs and burger was aweful. margarita was ok but i wonder why it was marked as RR. Staff was friendly but lady who took my order forgot abt the sauce which i ordered and i had to ask for water thrice. she was friendly but still getting the order right n fast is really important. she was taking order from almost all tables and i guess she was busy serving everyone. with all these drama n delay i qould change my rating 2 star. thumbs down guys!! it took 10 mins to get my check which is literally pathetic.

I wish I could give them 0 stars. I walked in and the hostess looked so miserable and was completely useless. We sat down and waited 20 minutes and our waitress who still wasn't there. We then saw our waitress carrying an entire tray of food on her shoulder, where her hair was touching the food. Hair should NEVER touch food. As our hostess sat us down, she wiped the crumbs from the table with her hands instead of legitimately cleaning it. They don't wipe the tables with any cleaners, which is why ours was dirty, instead they wipe it with their hands and a wet napkin. Completely disgusting and unsanitary. This place should be closed down for sanitization and health reasons.
What a disappointment... Service bad, burger described as gourmet far from it... Won't be back!!

Stopped in after a day of shopping, around 715pm on a Saturday evening. Was told the wait was 20 minutes for 3 but it definitely was less than that.  Once seated our server was there right away. Ordered apps and waited. And waited. It was super busy but it took a while to get our appetizers (as a side note, you can get just the cheese curds, and the pretzel nuggets and cheese are good but the cheese has a very strong beer flavor).  Our server did a nice job following up with us and letting us know our food was up soon. It was a long wait (probably 30-45 minutes from when we ordered dinner to when it came) but we didn't mind much. We used a Groupon and the manager came quickly to take care of that and our check (because there's apparently been a lot of fraud?)
Service is first class. And the food is excellent had the Boneless Buffalo Wings and my wife had the build a burger both meals were perfect. I would recommend this place to anyone!

I normally have had a good experience with Red Robin in the past, not recently though. This is the second time it has happened in the past week or so. I am a regular at this joint.  I wanted to place an order for to-go and called them. The call was answered and the details like my name etc. were taken. I was about to tell my order and at that point of time was put on hold. I was put on hold for about 10 minutes. When I called them again, the phone went unanswered. I eventually had to go there and place the order. When I told them my experience, they were apologetic and said they would see that my order is ready at the earliest. I did receive the order in about 5 minutes.  The customer service(or the lack of it rather) especially for the pick-up orders has been bad recently. I do hope for their own good, that they have an experienced person answering the phone calls and taking the to-go orders. I  have no complaints about the food and I think it is still pretty good. However, my recent experiences might prompt me to try other gourmet burger joints in the area.
For a chain burger joint, Red Robin in good. The service did take a bit long on Sunday afternoon though. We ordered the fish and chip dinner and Cobb salad. Our meals were satisfying.

Good for burgers, but awful for everything else on the menu. Every time my kids order something that is not a burger they screw it up. The broccoli was burned and the meatballs looked like they put them too long in the microwave. They were super dry. Not sure I want to come back.

So tonight I was craving a Red Robin Burger and the rest of my family decided we all wanted it for dinner so we ordered 4 burgers and 4 milkshakes. The girl on the phone let us know that it would about 15 minutes for the food to be ready, but when we got there we had to wait an additional 30 minutes just to receive our food..which was cold. Makes no sense why the food would be cold, when it "wasn't" ready yet. Then on top of that it took another 10 minutes for them to make our milkshakes because they decided to serve people at the bar first, although we had already been waiting for 30 minutes and PAID!!! The drinks were half way full and the manager had the nerve of saying " that's just how its done here", so...the way its done is by making your customers wait although they called in 30 MINUTES PRIOR, serve cold food and only give people half full drinks? WTF. What's the point of paying 3.00 for BARELY half of a cup...I'm sorry but NEVER AGAIN. Between  your horrible management service, horrible customer service, and COLD FOOD....and OVER PRICED DRINKS..... Definitely will be visiting Johnny Rockets!

Go to Wendys instead!! Visited here on a Sunday evening with a group of 7. Restaurant was maybe 1/4 full. Not busy. While they advertise "burgers and brews", after asking the waiter about regional selections mentioned  on the menu he admitted there were none. Closest was Sam Adams. Then informed me they didn't have many listed on menu. So much for brews.      We ordered a mix of beer, water and milkshakes. It took over 20 minutes to get our drinks. The waiter kept apologizing, obviously not his fault,     Entrees were ordered while waiting for drinks and again another long wait. When they arrived, 2 orders were incorrect, and the waiter didn't know which burgers were which and had to go back to the kitchen to ask..    I got the the Smoke and pepper burger which tasted of neither smoke or pepper, just pickles. Side salad was brown and disgusting. All the fries at the table were luke warm. Salted caramel milkshake was too salty to drink, as was the onion soup. The soup was removed by the server.    If you want a good burger visit one of the local burger places. Artisanal burger, Plan B, or Burger Fi. Or hit a fast food place for the same quality as Red Robin.
Horrible service and twice burger was sent back being the wrong order.. ALL DONE WITH THIS LOCATION

I used to love going to this restaurant chain...the staff, the atmosphere and the menu offerings were refreshing compared to other chains around. But lately every time I go there it's lackluster in all of the areas mentioned before.  Staff is not attentive. Food comes out late. Kitchen gets back up often. Lack of organization amongst the staff and their seating assignments. Patrons that arrive after us get the exact same meals before us. Inconsistency of presentation...some tables get plates with their apps, some don't. Staff don't track burgers for rewards club even when asked.  I thought this may be a store specific issue but sadly I've witnessed many of these issues at a number of locations. Not sure what's happened to this food chain, but I will sadly not be going back.

Good place to go if you got kids. Burgers are pretty good and I dig their onion rings. All the burgers come with bottomless steak fries, but I upgraded to the onion rings for an extra $1. No brainer for me. Understand it's a chain and what the deal is here.  They really cater to families.  It's gonna be noisy and chaotic at times. If you can accept that going in,  you're gonna be fine. I actually like the burgers here.  Not great, but good in my opinion. The staff are usually pretty friendly and  accommodating and the restaurant has been renovated recently. Kids get a balloon too. It's the simple things sometimes.

Update. There's probably 50 tables in this place, and about four have patrons. I, along with others, are put on a wait list. Come on management get it together and staff appropriately. Lost customers today. Went next door to longhorn steakhouse.

It's a bit pricey. Burgers start around $8 and go up from there. But that's pretty much standard for this type of restaurant. The service was good. Didn't have to wait too long. The environment is nice. The food is also well prepared.  The staff was very attentive. I would eat here again.

The kids dragged me out here tonight as we have not been to Red Robin since last year.  The Buckland Mall store has been refreshed and the changes are wonderful.  I think I subconsciously stopped going there because, although they have great burgers and salads, it always seemed loud to me.  That is not the case anymore, and this was with the restaurant absolutely full with a waiting list.  The new walls and screens are fantastic for cutting down the ambient noise, we actually talked as if we were at our dining room table.   First off, the service is great and the wait staff was not hurrying us but they were certainly on top of the next things that needed to be done at the table.  Their wings have always been on a par with Wooden Tap and J. Tim's and tonight was no exception.  For the first time ever, the kids actually finished a tower of onion rings (I need to understand they are getting bigger) and still had room for their burgers.   Our burgers were great.  I really appreciate the fact they have "adult" burgers, burgers that are creative and different and when I want really spicy they can deliver really spicy.  The kids were all happy with their choices and particularly like the real milkshakes they get.  We laughed at the fact that we never order dessert because we are always so full from fries and shakes.   One of the nicest things was I left a really good tip and the waitress walked right out the front door to thank us and wish us a good evening.  My thought is that Red Robin has made a substantial effort to tone down the noise and turn up the service and that really worked for us tonight.
My server was great, however, my food wasn't all the great. The onion straws on my burger tasted stale and the burger was pretty burnt. I love Red Robin, but today was a miss.

Went here on Sunday around 6ish my server was very nice but my food was not so great plate was dirty, food was freezing cold (who wants to eat cold mac and cheese) ew. Other people that was sitting near us kept sending food back cause it was the wrong order or it was cold. My husband asked for a burger and they brought him the wrong one twice very upset because other times I come here food be good this is the second Time this happens hope they can fix this problem.
Enjoyed the burger, and salad. Jay was very knowledgeable, attentive, and with good sense humor
Was there for lunch last week.  While the sandwich was only decent, the service was outstanding.  Justin, the waiter/bartender, was on-point throughout.  Could not have provided better service.

My gf and I decided to try Red Robin's again after years of not going. I won't lie I had high hopes coming in today, seeing how this location was good when they originally opened..and they haven't closed since. We were sat quickly, not many people inside. Food came out pretty fast and drinks as well. Everything tasted ok at best. Nothing to rant and rave about. Atmosphere was kind of meh. The real reason why I am giving these guys 2 stars is because of the waiter we had. He decided while he waits on tables that he'd test out his comedy career and joke around like we were his friends. Don't get me wrong, we are really chill and down to earth but when it comes to restaurants, we just want someone quick and efficient who doesn't mess up our orders...not much to ask for right? The kicker is when he went to go and give me my card, he pretended like it got declined...then handed me the receipt to sign and said hahahaha just kidding. Obviously Red Robin is where you go to work if you're trying to become a clown. The whole experience turned us off to coming back.
We've been here before and although I like it you end up with a Red Robin grease hangover. Not sure how to explain it. It's a bit on the heavy side.
Love this place ..Food always good no matter what you order.Staff is always nice and friendly .Love Jackie so sweet.

Very good service and food was pretty solid. THE fish of my fish and chips was a bit off but my wife's seared tuna, my friends' lobster roll, lobster taco, and Reuben got rave reviews. The raw bar took a bit to come out but was excellent.

Eeewww absolutely   disgusting burgers we ordered their French onion soup the onions were rubber and hard no flavor the fries are cheap frozen fries no wonder they are endless .. not to mention tasteless!! My burger was more boiled than broiled kind of like the ones  you get at the cheap carnivals where they store them in water. Didn't bother eating it .. when my tab came and wow $38 fir two burgers soup and lousy fries . I'll stick to burger king any day . At least their crapburgers are only $6...last visit to a "ROB" Robin.

Red Robin changed menus recently.  Several of our favorites now gone (sigh).  Used to have a very good mac and cheese - gone and the new tavern mac and cheese just doesn't rate.  The ice cream cake now gone.  It was limited edition but really warranted a prime time permanent slot on the menu.

So far, not a good visit. Seating snafus, no setups, no fries, change of menu with a firm "NO" on my request to recreate a signature burger. Safe to say this will be our last trip to Red Robin. Pity, because they were good in the past.
Large servings.  Good milkshakes. Good service. Bottomless fries. From soup and salad to burgers

It's a burger place, don't expect capitail grill. That being said, i'm super into low carb and they do an amazing job lettuce wrapping their burgers. Service is always good and the food is better. I go during lunch on weekdays. The few times I have been at night or on a weekend it's pretty busy.

NOW WITH MORE GUAC!!!! If I could post a title I think this is fitting. Orders the Salsa Guac appetizer and they had a burst that said "now with more GUAC". What we got was a spoonful. We sent it back. About 20-25 minutes later we got my burger, her bowl of chili, a kids Mac and cheese and a kids corndog. Kids meals were cold, my burger which I asked for "some pink" was well done. Was told we would have a manager sent over. No such case. After eating what we could of our terrible food, (Kids ate the oranges) we got our bill. Charged for untouched kids meals. Sadly we have another $25 gift certificate. Probably sell on offered up. Slow to get order and bad food. Used to be good. What happened?

This Red Robin is a solid 4 establishment. Their fries are soooooo good with the fry flavoring and I can't recall anything I've never liked here. Normally I get the whiskey burger but yesterday I was more bold and tried the double taco seasoned burger and it was amazing, with a little kick thanks to the pepper jack cheese they put on it. My sweet potato fries needed to be cooked a little longer, but the mozz sticks were on point. I had their drink special, the orange cinn-a-rita, and omg it's like a delicious alcoholic sunny delight, I think that's the best comparison I can come up with for it. I highly recommend it. What really impressed me too is I went with my friend and her one year old little girl and my friend was worried about cleaning up under the baby's high chair and the waitress was super nice and said no no they'd take care of it. Which really spoke volumes, seeing as how most servers would complain about having to clean up after a little one. I'll def be back for another burger soon.

Yes this is a chain, but dang their burgers are good! This is one of my go to cheat places and I don't feel bad about it. The unlimited fries is also a huge plus! Especially with their special seasoning.  Don't push Red Robin aside, they know how to make that classic BBQ summer burger just right!
